paragraphs.text: From Guantanamo to Montevideo and on to Havana.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The news of the Guantanamo detainees' arrival to Uruguay received impressive coverage in international media
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Uruguay is the second Latin American country to accept Guantanamo detainees
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the first one was El Salvador, which welcomed two Chinese nationals in 2012
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The fact that there have been only two countries in Latin America accepting Guantanamo inmates is already particularly extraordinary, given US historical ascendancy on the region
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Even US' main allies in the region, Chile and Colombia, rejected US proposals to accept prisoners from Guantanamo, considering the move highly unpopular
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Perhaps the spotlight fell on Uruguay as a Guantanamo detainee host because of Mujica's own media popularity over his unusually humble way of life as a world leader, and his progressive public speeches and political agenda
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He also managed to get a lot of media attention over the arrival of around forty Syrian refugees in October
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: although they were few in number compared to the thousands of refugees that neighbouring countries such as Brazil and Argentina have been accepting
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: The day the detainees landed in Montevideo, Mujica sent an open letter to Uruguayans and Barack Obama
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The first sentence reads,"Solidarity is the tenderness of the people", a quote from Pablo Neruda referring to the 1939 exodus of Spanish Republicans escaping fascism to South America
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Neruda's words well reflect the main humanitarian goal of the operation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which aims to to reinforce the image of Uruguay as a peacemaker and international reference for humanitarian issues
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Pepe" has the aspiration, before ceding power to Tabare Vazquez at the beginning of 2015, to spread his humanitarian legacy and reinforce his world reputation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Through the well-publicised gesture, Mujica aims to give hope to all those disenchanted people who still think that idealism and ethics in politics are still possible
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From a political perspective, Mujica's usual anti-imperialist stance left many in Uruguay astonished that he was willing to do a "favour" to Obama and accept the Guantanamo detainees
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is only in the second part of his open letter that his political goals become apparent
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mujica asks, as a gesture of reconciliation for all the American people, for the release of a 70 years-old Puerto Rican independence fighter, along with three Cuban detainees who are part of the group known as the Cuban Five
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: whose controversial detention in the late 1990s led to a worldwide campaign for their release
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: He also asks for the lifting of the "unjust embargo" imposed on "our sister" Cuba
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mujica's plea is reflective of an emerging regional bloc different than the usual "left-leaning" one
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is instead a heterogeneous regional political bloc able to come to terms with ideological differences and to find common ground for regional coexistence in the name of progress
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Best example of this is the ongoing peace talks between FARC and the Colombian government in Cuba, with the participation of Chile and Venezuela
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Mujica's move, therefore, is not unprecedented
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Back in 2009 the late Hugo Chavez hinted at the possibility of accepting Guantanamo detainees in Venezuela and at raising the issue of Cuba's isoluation
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Cuba's reintegration into regional life, after decades of US ostracism, represents the main political goal of the bloc and of Mujica humanitarian operation
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Therefore
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it is not surprise that Jose Miguel Insulza, the Secretary General of the Organization of American States (OAS) publicly lauded Mujica's move
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Although leftist American governments have been particularly at odds with the Washington-based regional organisation, as consequence of the informal exclusion of Cuba under US pressure
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Insulza has been working hard to reverse it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Just recently, he said that he hoped both Cuba and the US would attend the next OAS summit planned for April in Panama City
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The US is unlikely to release the Cuban political prisoners
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Cuba's unilateral release of Alan Gross after 5 years could be part of a larger swap following Mujica's move
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The six Guantanamo detainees will probably be the last ones to be resettled in the region
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: their landing in Montevideo made it clear that Latin America is not, and will not be again the US backyard
paragraphs.label: assumption
